content.prompt: Farmers use various methods of irrigation on crops. Which of the following statements correctly pairs an irrigation method with an advantage or disadvantage?

choices.label: Drip irrigation is readily used in large-scale farming because of the low cost associated with this method.
Flood irrigation is often used in agricultural fields, however, it increases surface erosion and salinization of the soil.
Furrow irrigation is a method in which farmers plant two different types of crops in alternating strips which increases productivity.
Spray irrigation loses the least amount of water to evaporation.

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Describe disadvantages, advantages, or unintended consequences for potential solutions.
